Operation 'post-createPermit' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The current description is too brief and lacks critical details about what permits are, what inputs are required, what is returned, and the operational effect. Added context about permit purpose, required inputs (contract reference, shopper details), return value (permit reference and status), and side effects (immediate availability for transactions) to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_summary: Create new permits linked to a recurring contract.
data.current_description: Create permits for a recurring contract, including support for defining restrictions.
data.description_suggestion: Creates permits for a recurring contract with optional restrictions. Permits define authorization rules for recurring transactions. Requires the recurring contract reference and shopper details. Returns a permit object containing the permit reference and status. The created permit becomes immediately available for use in recurring transactions.
data.reasoning: The current description is too brief and lacks critical details about what permits are, what inputs are required, what is returned, and the operational effect. Added context about permit purpose, required inputs (contract reference, shopper details), return value (permit reference and status), and side effects (immediate availability for transactions) to improve AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'post-notifyShopper' has semantic quality issues: missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Current description lacks input requirements and output details. Added clarity about required parameters (shopper reference, recurring detail reference, amount), what is returned (notification status), and the regulatory context for India-specific acquiring. This helps AI agents understand when this operation is applicable and what data is needed.

data.current_summary: Ask issuer to notify the shopper
data.current_description: Sends a request to the issuer so they can inform the shopper about the upcoming recurring payment. This endpoint is used only for local acquiring in India. For more information, refer to [Recurring card payments in India](https://docs.adyen.com/payment-methods/cards/cards-recurring-india).
data.description_suggestion: Sends a notification request to the card issuer to inform the shopper about an upcoming recurring payment. This operation is specific to local acquiring in India and is required for compliance with local recurring payment regulations. Requires the shopper reference, recurring detail reference, and payment amount. Returns a notification status confirming the request was sent to the issuer. For more information, refer to [Recurring card payments in India](https://docs.adyen.com/payment-methods/cards/cards-recurring-india).
data.reasoning: Current description lacks input requirements and output details. Added clarity about required parameters (shopper reference, recurring detail reference, amount), what is returned (notification status), and the regulatory context for India-specific acquiring. This helps AI agents understand when this operation is applicable and what data is needed.

message: Operation 'post-scheduleAccountUpdater' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary is vague about what Account Updater does. Description focuses only on input validation rules without explaining the operation's purpose, what it returns, or its effects. Enhanced summary to clarify the operation refreshes payment details. Expanded description to explain the purpose (refresh and validate), input options with their requirements, return value (scheduling confirmation and job reference), and side effects (asynchronous update and shopper notification) for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
When making the API call, you can submit either the credit card information, or the recurring detail reference and the shopper reference:
 * If the card information is provided, all the sub-fields for `card` are mandatory.
 * If the recurring detail reference is provided, the fields for `shopperReference` and `selectedRecurringDetailReference` are mandatory.
data.summary_suggestion: Schedule Account Updater to refresh payment details
data.description_suggestion: Schedules the Account Updater service to refresh and validate stored payment details. Accepts either direct card information or a reference to an existing recurring detail. If providing card information, all card sub-fields are mandatory. If providing a recurring detail reference, both shopperReference and selectedRecurringDetailReference are mandatory. Returns a scheduling confirmation with the update job reference. The Account Updater will asynchronously validate and update the payment details, notifying the shopper of any changes.
data.reasoning: Original summary is vague about what Account Updater does. Description focuses only on input validation rules without explaining the operation's purpose, what it returns, or its effects. Enhanced summary to clarify the operation refreshes payment details. Expanded description to explain the purpose (refresh and validate), input options with their requirements, return value (scheduling confirmation and job reference), and side effects (asynchronous update and shopper notification) for better AI agent understanding.
